definition: to pacify/to calm/calm/quiet/to lie on one's belly
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
to lean over/to fall (go down)/to hide (in ambush)/to conceal oneself/to lie low/hottest days of summer/to submit/to concede defeat/to overcome/to subdue/volt

sentences.english: You might occasionally be calm and still, but never for long.
sentences.chinese: 你偶尔会显得冷静，平伏，但永不会太久。

sentences.english: They prostrated themselves before the altar.
When the mind is serene, Truth shines.
sentences.chinese: 当人的内心平伏下来，真理就会自然显现。

sentences.english: Those that are aligned in the place are called equatorial hydrogens .
sentences.chinese: 那些在平面上定向的氢叫做平伏氢。

sentences.english: Your alertness fades, and your mood dips.

definition: to pacify/to calm down/to be cured/to be healed
to roll over and over (of billows or clouds)
to turn over/to surge/to churn/to rummage/raging (torrent)
to stir/to lift/to set sth in motion
variant of 壓服|压服[ya1 fu2]
to press down/to crush down/to restrain (anger)/to keep down (voice)
